title: How to Do a 24 Hour Gaming Marathon

steps.headline: Pick a console to use and a game to play on that console.
Get snacks to eat during the marathon.
steps.description:
Some examples of good snacks are:
Cheetos
Chips
Pizza
Cookies
Dunkaroos

steps.headline: Get drinks for the marathon.
steps.description: You need to stay hydrated and awake throughout the whole marathon. Drink lots of water and no more than two energy drinks per person.

steps.headline: Get a friend (or two!).
steps.description: Friends are always good to game with, and it will get very sad, lonely, and messy if you do it alone.

steps.headline: Take ten minute breaks every 2 hours of gaming.
steps.description: It isn't good to just game for the whole 24 hours, otherwise it could damage your eyesight.

steps.headline: Pick a date, and coordinate with friends.
steps.description: Remember to pick a day that won't interfere with anything important, such as school or work. Some good days to do marathons if you are in school are Fridays and Saturdays.

steps.headline: Get at least ten hours of sleep the night before you do your marathon.
steps.description: The marathon itself may be exciting, but you need to sleep to function. You don't want to quit six hours in because you're tired.

steps.headline: Have fun!
steps.description: Don't worry. Just sit back and game. Nothing can stop you now.

Remember to pick a day that won't interfere with anything important, such as school or work. Some good days to do marathons if you are in school are Fridays and Saturdays. Get at least ten hours of sleep the night before you do your marathon. The marathon itself may be exciting, but you need to sleep to function.
